intro: Cestrum pauciflorum, commonly known as the night-blooming cestrum, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 2 to 6 meters. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, tubular flowers that bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its leaves are opposite, elliptic, and have a smooth texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, round seeds.
